channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Yes, tariffs will hurt Ford and GM. Here’s an argument for buying the stocks.
U.S. trade gap narrowed slightly in February after January’s record
‘This is not real investment’: global trade expert on Apple’s $500 billion claim
Fourth-quarter U.S. economic growth rate revised upward, but Q1 looks less rosy
U.S. jobless-benefits claims not reflecting a significant ‘DOGE’ surge
Trump announces 25% tariffs on all cars 'not made in the United States'
item.description: Trump had hinted that the auto tariffs could arrive prior to April 2, the day his sweeping "reciprocal tariff" plan is set to begin.

item.title: EU says 'unconditional withdrawal' of Russia from Ukraine is a precondition to amend sanctions
item.description: The withdrawal of all Russian forces from Ukraine would be one of the main conditions to lift or amend EU sanctions, a European Commission spokesperso...

item.title: Europe wants to pour billions of dollars into its own defense companies — but market watchers say it may not be able to shut American firms out
item.description: As Europe looks to hike defense spending, CNBC spoke to industry experts about how the money could be spent — and where it leaves U.S. firms.

item.title: The Atlantic publishes full Signal thread with Hegseth, Waltz after Trump says texts not classified
